greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(1) = 1, a(prime(n)) = A206074(a(n)), a(composite(n)) = A205783(1+a(n)), where A206074 and A205783 give binary codes for polynomials with coefficients 0 or 1 that are irreducible [resp. reducible] over Q.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10001
Index entries for sequences that are permutations of the natural numbers
formula: a(1) = 1; for n > 1, if A010051(n) = 1 [when n is a prime], then a(n) = A206074(a(A000720(n))), otherwise [when n is a composite], a(n) = A205783(1+a(A065855(n))).
As a composition of related permutations:
xref: Related permutations: A245703, A246377, A260422, A260425.
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Jul 25 2015
